Mode.name: DES
Mode.Description: Managed Descent (DES) follows the vertical profile defined in the Flight Management System (FMS), including altitude constraints and speed targets appropriate for the descent phase. The mode provides an efficient, constraint‑aware descent along the programmed vertical path.
Mode.Activation: Activated by pushing the Altitude selector knob when the selected altitude is below the current altitude and a valid FMS vertical profile is available.
Mode.Behavior: The aircraft follows the FMS‑defined descent path. Autothrust typically commands idle thrust, and pitch is adjusted to maintain the managed descent speed. The mode transitions to ALT* when approaching the selected altitude, and then to ALT once level‑off is complete.
